Key Match Events: Kevin De Bruyne scored the second goal for Belgium in the 80th minute
Youri Tielemans scored the opening goal for Belgium in the second minute
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin De Bruyne stated, 'We knew what we needed to do. We needed to win otherwise we were going home'
Domenico Tedesco, Belgium coach, said, 'I’m very relieved we won the game. It was very important to get the three points'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of Belgium’s royal family, King Philippe and Queen Mathilde
Others: The result means all four teams in Group E have three points and there is all to play for in the final round of games on Wednesday, when Belgium plays Ukraine and Romania takes on Slovakia
